alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 7:33AM EST until January 17 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Little Falls affecting Passaic and Essex Counties. Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Passaic, Morris and Essex Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River Above Singac affecting Passaic, Morris and Essex Counties. For the Passaic River...including Little Falls, Pine Brook, Singac... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River above Singac. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Portions of the Wayne Town Center parking lot begin to flood. Hobson Avenue and Riverlawn Drive in Wayne begin to flood. Fairfield Road, Fayette Avenue, and Riversedge Road in Wayne can flood as water backs up the Pompton River. Lincoln Boulevard in Lincoln Park can also flood due to backwater up the Pompton river. The Pequannock River Park also floods. At 9.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield is subject to closures. At 9.5 feet, Camp Lane and Marginal Road in Fairfield begins to flood. At 10.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield begins to flood. Finns Drive, Siesta Drive, and Market street in Wayne are all susceptible to flooding. William Street, Louis Street, and Zeliff Avenue in Little Falls can begin to flood. Portions of Lincoln Park become impassable. The Meadows Golf Club in Lincoln Park floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM EST Tuesday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning and continue falling to 7.2 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 05/03/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Passaic River Singac 8.5 9.7 Tue 6 am 8.6 7.5 Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 745 PM EST.
